translation.title: Weaknesses in Training and Mindfulness Meditation

segments.en: 63. Weaknesses in Training and Mindfulness Meditation
“Mendicants, there are these five weaknesses when you’re training.
Killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
These are the five weaknesses when you’re training.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ sikkhādubbalyānaṃ pahānāya cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvetabbā.
segments.en: To give up these five weaknesses in your training you should develop the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
They meditate observing an aspect of the mind …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: They meditate observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ sikkhādubbalyānaṃ pahānāya ime cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvetabbā”ti.
segments.en: To give up those five weaknesses in your training you should develop these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
